name: Prime Rib Bolognese

ingredients.ingredient: San Marzano tomatoes, crushed by hand

instructions: Heat olive oil in a cocotte over medium heat.
Add onion, carrot, and celery. Sauté until soft, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in garlic and tomato paste; cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Pour in red wine and let it simmer until mostly evaporated, about 3-4 minutes.
Add crushed San Marzano tomatoes and prime rib broth.
Stir in oregano, basil, red pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper.
Add shredded prime rib beef and stir to combine.
Reduce heat to low and let the sauce simmer for 60-90 minutes, stirring occasionally.
If the sauce thickens too much, add a bit more broth or water.
Stir in milk or cream for a silkier texture, if using. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Cook fresh fettuccine in salted boiling water for 1-3 minutes.
Drain pasta, reserving ½ cup of pasta water. Toss pasta with sauce to coat evenly.
Serve hot, topped with grated Parmesan.

storage_tips.refrigeration: Store in an airtight container for up to 4 days.
storage_tips.freezing: Freeze sauce in portions for up to 3 months.
